Class Scanner

java.lang.Object
Scanner
public class Scanner extends Object
Scanner is a simple scanner for Compilers and Interpreters (2014-2015) lab exercise 1
Version:
1.0 Usage: Used to scan an input file and sequentially output tokens present in that file TODO: support NESTED block comments \/**\/ method descriptions <= >= <> := == are single token
Author:
Boxuan Shan

  • Constructor Details

    • Scanner

      public Scanner(InputStream inStream)
      Scanner constructor for construction of a scanner that uses an InputStream object for input. Usage: FileInputStream inStream = new FileInputStream(new File(); Scanner lex = new Scanner(inStream);
      Parameters:
      inStream - the input stream to use

    • Scanner

      public Scanner(String inString)
      Scanner constructor for constructing a scanner that scans a given input string. It sets the end-of-file flag an then reads the first character of the input string into the instance field currentChar. Usage: Scanner lex = new Scanner(input_string);
      Parameters:
      inString - the string to scan

  • Method Details

    • getNextChar

      private void getNextChar()
      returns next character in input, sets this.eof true if reach eof

    • eat

      private void eat(char expected) throws ScanErrorException
      scan to next char if currentChar matches expected
      Throws:
      ScanErrorException - if expected char does not match currentChar
      Precondition:
      currentChar is not last character, e.g. this.eof is false
      Postcondition:
      advances currentChar by one char, if expected char matches currentChar
      Parameters:
      expected - next character expected in input

    • hasNext

      public boolean hasNext()
      Returns:
      true if not at end of file

    • isDigit

      public static boolean isDigit(char c)
      Parameters:
      c - character to check
      Returns:
      true if c is a digit between 0 and 9, inclusive

    • isLetter

      public static boolean isLetter(char c)
      Parameters:
      c - character to check
      Returns:
      true if c is an upper/lowercase letter

    • isSpace

      public static boolean isSpace(int c)
      Parameters:
      c - character to check
      Returns:
      true if c is any type of whitespace: '\n', '\r', '\t' and ' '

    • getCurrentChar

      public char getCurrentChar()
      used for debug
      Returns:
      the current character being read

    • isIdentifier

      private static boolean isIdentifier(char c)
      Parameters:
      c - character to check
      Returns:
      true if c is either a letter, digit, or an underline

    • isOperator

      private static boolean isOperator(char c)
      Parameters:
      c - character to check
      Returns:
      true if c is an operator, defined by the instance String OPS

    • scanNumber

      private String scanNumber() throws ScanErrorException
      Throws:
      ScanErrorException - if currentChar does not represent a digit
      Precondition:
      isDigit(currentChar) is true, currentChar is on first digit of number
      Postcondition:
      currentChar is on the character right after the number

    • scanIdentifier

      private String scanIdentifier() throws ScanErrorException
      Throws:
      ScanErrorException - if currentChar does not represent an identifier
      Precondition:
      isIdentifier(currentChar) is true, currentChar is on first digit of identifier
      Postcondition:
      currentChar is on the character right after the identifier

    • scanOperator

      private String scanOperator() throws ScanErrorException
      Throws:
      ScanErrorException - if currentChar does not represent an operator
      Precondition:
      isOperator(currentChar) is true, currentChar is on first digit of operator
      Postcondition:
      currentChar is on the character right after the operator

    • nextToken

      public String nextToken() throws ScanErrorException
      Throws:
      ScanErrorException
      Precondition:
      Returns:
      next token in input: number, identifier or operator
